channel.title: Small Question ( midieval warfare )
channel.description:
Has anyone seen lord of the rings? Ok. In the first or second movie ( cant remember which ) the orcs are seen molding swords in the part where all the trees fall into the hole.
The swords were more like claymores. They were two handed, and had a short blade sticking out at a 90 degree angle at the tip to cleaver heads.
They looked sort of like this:
----]================ []
I can't find out what they're called. I tried searching for things like claymore, blade, cleaver, head and similiar on wiki but I can't find anything. Anyone here have an idea of what they're called?

item.title: Small Question ( midieval warfare )
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Gladiators used a sword almost similar to that one. I can’t really remember the name of it though. I can do a little search for you.

Edit: The weapon is called a Sica. Thracians used it. It’s not that similar to the one VB7 Rocks posted but it’s more rounded.

Wikipedia page about it: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sica

Read full topic

item.title: Small Question ( midieval warfare )
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

1337h4x:

o well thanks. Man I wanted to make one of those and kill some bitches up. Guess I’ll have to go with a spartan shortsword

The only thing wrong with the model one is that it’s “False Edged”. Just get a blade sharpener and sharpen 'er up. lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Small Question ( midieval warfare )
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

I believe they call this weapon:

an “Orc Scimitar” or something like that. I doubt it’s a real weapon, probably just something whoever wrote the books invented.

Here’s another picture, it’s the third one down:

Read full topic

item.title: Small Question ( midieval warfare )
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:2, topic:136747”]Maybe they’re not called anything and the makers of the movie put them there because they look cool? -.-[/quote]No, I know that they’re real weapons and have been used before

Actually there might be a chance that they aren’t real…I really don’t know. But it seems like a really good idea for a weapon though

Read full topic
